comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Typo -- caption says "I H P", not "1".  IHP I think stands for "indicated horsepower."

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: HMS Leviathan was a 14,100-ton Drake-class armoured cruiser of the Royal Navy, and the third ship to bear the name. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Leviathan_(1901) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91829349@N00] correct: Indicated Horsepower refers to the power exerted in the cylinder of an engine, stated in horse powers, estimated from the diameter and speed of the piston, and the mean effective pressure upon it as shown by an indicator. the actual power output may only be 70% to 90% of the indicated horsepower For this ship it translated to 2 screws, speed 23 kn (26 mph; 43 km/h)
